wikipedia_page.main: George Hunn Nobbs (16 October, 1799 – 5 November, 1884) was an English missionary on Pitcairn Island and later Norfolk Island, where many of his descendants still live today.

response: On his way back to England from Ceylon, Fremantle in September 1832 visited the Swan River Colony for a week, but never returned. In 1833 he stopped at Pitcairn Island, where he tried to resolve a leadership dispute between Joshua Hill and George Hunn Nobbs. He was given command of  in the Mediterranean Fleet in 1843 and of , also in the Mediterranean, in 1847. Then in 1853 he became Captain of  on the Australia Station.
**** Sarah Christian (1810 – 5 December 1899) m. George Hunn Nobbs, Pitcairn's first minister
